DataHubPageTemplateProperties.description: The main properties of a DataHub page template

rows.description: The rows of modules contained in this template

assetSummary.description: The optional info for asset summaries. Should be populated if surfaceType is ASSET_SUMMARY

surface.description: Info about the surface area of the product that this template is deployed in

visibility.description: Info about the visibility of this template

created.description: Audit stamp for when and by whom this template was created

lastModified.description: Audit stamp for when and by whom this template was last updated

DataHubPageTemplateRow.description: A row of modules contained in a template

modules.description: The modules that exist in this template row

DataHubPageTemplateAssetSummary.description: The page template info for asset summaries

summaryElements.description: The optional list of properties shown on an asset summary page header.

SummaryElement.description: Info for a given asset summary element

structuredPropertyUrn.description: The urn of the structured property shown. Required if propertyType is STRUCTURED_PROPERTY

DataHubPageTemplateSurface.description: Info about the surface area of the product that this template is deployed in

surfaceType.description: Where exactly is this template being used

DataHubPageTemplateVisibility.description: Info about the visibility of this template

scope.description: The scope of this template and who can use/see it

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.
